page.text: Anastasia Bolshakov
9221 Sunbonnet Dr.
Pearland, TX 77584
bolanya15@gmail.com
To whomever it concerns,
I was immensely fortunate to attend Rice University which, like most liberal arts schools, teaches its graduates
how to think not what to think. After double majoring in Political Science and Asian Studies, with a minor in
Sociology, I've gained the ability to analyze, think critically and independently and the capacity for constantly
learning. During my time at Rice, I was able to conduct research with Dr. Stephen Klineberg and the Kinder
Institute through the Houston area surgery, as well as conduct policy research abroad in Istanbul, Turkey and
Shanghai, China.
Throughout my life, yearbook has played a major role. I've been able to serve in an editorial capacity on various
yearbook staffs since starting in the 7th grade. I was honored to be part of the founding editorial staff of The
Aerie, Glenda Dawson High School's yearbook and the editorial staff of the revamp effort of the Campanile, Rice
University's undergraduate yearbook, which is now a nationally-recognized, award-winning book. While many
are surprised that yearbooks even exist, being a part of these various staffs, I've gained valuable skills in
marketing, staff management, long-term planning, design, AP-Style standards, news, editorial and feature writing,
dealing with budgets, so cola media strategy, editing, and, of course, setting and meeting deadlines. During my
time at Rice, I had to ability to attend various College Media Conventions, as well as being able to share my
personal knowledge as a speaker and presenter. I’ve gained experience in Adobe Photoshop, Lightroom, InDesign
and Illustrator; and was in charge of the marketing and social media for the yearbook while I was there. I also am
a quick study when it comes to computer programs and HTML, and am always willing to learn more.
For the past year, I have been managing the social media accounts for Housing and Dining (including @Sammy’s,
the Farmers Market and Rice Sweets) and Facilities, Engineering and Planning at Rice University. I have gained
experience in creating content management plans and executing them, as well as watching analytics and
cultivating responses. Through my work with my supervisor, I have been able to work with various departments
and executives and managers at Rice University, including Public Affairs, the Welcome Center, the Rice
University Police Department and the Commencement Committee on their marketing and communications plans
and implementations. I have also helped transition Housing and Dining, Sustainability and Facilities, Engineering
and Planning to new websites, and have been working on keeping those websites up to date.
I have also previously worked at the Rice Annual Fund. At the Annual Fund, I designed marketing materials for
various events on campus, including College Battle, National Philanthropy Week and Jar Wars. I was also a
photographer for Annual Fund events, including reunion parties, leadership donor events and student donor
events. While volunteering for the Rice Annual Fund Student Initiative, I was tasked with planning senior donor
receptions around campus. I also raised donations for the Annual Fund through the Telefund, and also through
my work as a Senior Gift Representative – overall raising about $100,000 for the university.
I appreciate you taking the time to review my credentials and experience. Thank you for your time -- I look
forward to learning more about this opportunity!
Sincerely,
Anastasia Bolshakov
bolanya15@gmail.com
Rice University, Houston, TX (2011-2015)
Bachelor of Arts in Political Science and Asian Studies, Minor in Sociology, 3.54 Cumulative GPA
Glenda Dawson High School, Pearland, TX (2007-2011)
Graduated magna cum laude, 4.784 Cumulative GPA

Gold Circle Awards from the Columbia Scholastic Press Association
